questions.text: Why did the chicken cross the road?

options.text: To get to the other side?
To die and go to heaven?
To sniff a cat made of jam?
Because a duke shot an osterich cause he was hungry
The vile hun and their evil empire
Because it was easier than not having a war

title: A list of important WW1 heroes

heroes.title: [Allen [sic] Oswald Coker]
heroes.history: Of 5th Pioneer Battalion (5th Pioneers)  from Prospect  killed in action 29 July 1918, France.
heroes.subject: Coker, Allan Oswald, 1879-1918;World War, 1914-1918 -- South Australia
heroes.source: Chronicle, 17 August 1918, p. 27, col. b;Chronicle, 31 August 1918, p. 39, col. a;Chronicle, 26 October 1918, p. 38, col. a

heroes.title: [Private H. W. Richards]
heroes.history: Private, 11th Reinforcements, 10th Battalion  from Woodville  killed in action 7 July 1918, aged 29  electricity meter inspector  third son of Mr. and Mrs. W. Richards.
heroes.subject: Richards, Harold William, 1889-1918;World War, 1914-1918 -- South Australia
heroes.source: Chronicle, 17 August 1918, p. 26, col. b  p. 39, col. a;Chronicle, 10 August 1918, p. 39, col. c

heroes.title: [Private Maurice Theobald]
heroes.history: Private, service number 4863, 43rd Battalion  from Meadows  killed in action 26 August 1918, France, aged 23 years and 7 months  banker  eldest son of Rev. Thomas and Mrs Theobald, fiance of Laura Genge.
heroes.subject: Theobald, Maurice James, 1895-1918;World War, 1914-1918 -- South Australia
heroes.source: Chronicle, 14 September 1918, p. 27, col. e;Chronicle, 21 September 1918, p. 27, col. c;Chronicle, 2 November 1918, p. 26, col. d  p. 38, col. b

heroes.title: [Private George Danford Neave]
heroes.history: Private, 10th Battalion  killed in action 18 September 1915, Gallipoli  cousin of Fred and Stella.
heroes.subject: Neave, George Danford, 1894-1915;World War, 1914-1918 -- South Australia
heroes.source: Chronicle, 14 September 1918, p. 28, col. b;Chronicle, 21 September 1918, p. 28, col. e

heroes.title: [Lieutenant Frank Rosevear]
heroes.history: Lieutenant (acting Captain), 13th London Regiment  from Meadowside  killed in action 23 August 1918, aged 25  brother of L. A. Wilde and Captain Archie Rosevear (invalided out, London), son of Mrs. E. C. Rosevear.
heroes.subject: Rosevear, Frank, d. 1918.;World War, 1914-1918 -- South Australia
heroes.source: Chronicle, 7 September 1918, p. 27, col. c;Chronicle, 14 September 1918, p. 24, col. a  p.38, col. d

heroes.title: [Private Harry Emsley]
heroes.history: Private, 16th Battalion  from Prospect  killed in action 8 August 1918, France, aged 34  fourth son of Mrs. J. E. Emsley.
heroes.subject: Emsley, Harry, 1884-1918;World War, 1914-1918 -- South Australia
heroes.source: Chronicle, 14 September 1918, p. 24, col. b  p. 38, col. c

heroes.title: [Private L. Dodd]
heroes.history: Private, 43rd Battalion, service number 4776  from Broken Hill  killed in action 22 August 1918, France, aged 20.
heroes.subject: Dodd, Lindsay Ray, 1897-1918;World War, 1914-1918 -- South Australia
heroes.source: Chronicle, 14 September 1918, p. 24, col. b;Chronicle, 28 September 1918, p. 38, col. d;Chronicle, 19 October 1918, p. 37, col. d

heroes.title: [Lieutenant Sydney C. Stockham]
heroes.history: Lieutenant, 27th Battalion  from Fullarton  died of wounds 18 August 1918, France, aged 28  youngest son of G. W. and S. Stockham.
heroes.subject: Stockham, Sydney C., 1889-1918;World War, 1914-1918 -- South Australia
heroes.source: Chronicle, 7 September 1918, p. 27, col. c;Chronicle, 14 September 1918, p. 24, col. c  p. 38, col. d

heroes.title: [Lieutenant Alfred H. Moss]
heroes.history: Lieutenant, original 10th Battalion  from Smithfield  drowned from the torpedoed hospital ship Warilda, aged 21  second son of Mrs. A. M. Moss  brother of Howard and Cyril.
heroes.subject: Moss, Alfred Hubert, 1896-1918;World War, 1914-1918 -- South Australia
heroes.source: Chronicle, 17 August 1918, p. 27, col. c;Chronicle, 14 September 1918, p. 24, col. d

heroes.title: [Private Claud William Mason]
heroes.history: Private, D Company, 48th Battalion  from O'Halloran Hill  killed in action 8 August 1918, France, aged 23  youngest son of Mr. and Mrs. J. W. Mason  student Surveyor.
heroes.subject: Mason, Claud William, 1894-1918;World War, 1914-1918 -- South Australia
heroes.source: Chronicle, 31 August 1918, p. 27, col. e;Chronicle, 28 September 1918, p. 34, col. e  p. 39, col. a;Chronicle, 14 September 1918, p. 24, col. d

heroes.title: [Sergeant Percy Oliver Gunn]
heroes.history: Sergeant, service number 816, 2nd Machine Gun Battalion  from Adelaide  died of wounds 9 August 1918, France, aged 29  youngest son, brother of Mrs. A. E. Moller and Mrs. A. R. Wenzel.
heroes.subject: Gunn, Percy Oliver, 1889-1918;World War, 1914-1918 -- South Australia
heroes.source: Chronicle, 31 August 1918, p. 31, col. c  p. 39, col. a;Chronicle, 7 September 1918, p. 39, col. b;Chronicle, 14 September 1918, p. 24, col. e

heroes.title: [Private B. C. Dawe]
heroes.history: Private  from Port Adelaide  killed in action 11 August 1918  married.
heroes.subject: Dawe, Bertie Chloride, 1887-1918;World War, 1914-1918 -- South Australia
heroes.source: Chronicle, 14 September 1918, p. 24, col. e  p. 38, col. c

heroes.title: [Driver Arthur Cooper]
heroes.history: Driver  killed in action 22 August 1918, France  sixth son of W.S. and M.M. Cooper.
heroes.subject: Cooper, Arthur, 1896-1918;World War, 1914-1918 -- South Australia
heroes.source: Chronicle, 14 September 1918, p. 24, col. e  p. 27, col. c  p. 38, col. c

heroes.title: [Corporal George L. Grinter]
heroes.history: Corporal, 43rd Battalion, service number 71  from Bowden  killed in action 23 August 1918, France  aged 20  son of Staff Sergeant-Major and Mrs. Grinter, brother of Ethel, Stan and Ben.
heroes.subject: Grinter, George Leslie, 1898-1918;World War, 1914-1918 -- South Australia
heroes.source: Chronicle, 14 September 1918, p. 24, col. f  p. 27, col. c;Chronicle, 28 September 1918, p. 38, col. e;Chronicle, 19 October 1918, p. 37, col. d
